title: How long before Jungle Morde is nerfed into the ground?
body:
{{champion:82}}  {{summoner:11}} 

Passive is proc'd by jungle monsters, dragon, Rift Herald, and Baron Nashor, free {{item:3068}} that in fact does more damage
Q - does critical damage to ANY enemy that is alone
W - Quick to build and can be consumed easily for jungle sustain
E - surprisingly effective ganking tool
R - You are guaranteed to get SOMEONE unless you CHOOSE to fuck it up or are just that bad

{{item:1413}}  - stacks with passive, gives you more tank stats early
{{item:3009}} - Run down anyone early
{{item:3116}} First big buy, keep them ganks going
{{item:3742}} Second big buy, again, keep the ganks going

Pros: 
-Decent clear time
-Safe from counter jungling as you don't want to fight a Morde alone, especially post 6
-Amazing self sustain
-CC is like a mini Blitz pull with how great it is for re-positioning an enemy
-Ult will almost always guarantee you a kill, or a revenge kill if you get invaded 
-The build allows you to run down nearly anyone or burn summoners at little cost to yourself


Cons:
-Miss your E on a gank and you miss out
-NEEDS red buff early, and has a pretty predictable set of jungle paths, like many junglers granted, but he REALLY needs that red buff.
-Can still be invaded if enemy team decides to and he has no viable escapes like other junglers outside of flash

Give it a try guys before Riot removes Morde's ability to jungle.

replies.body:
Jungle Morde is not even the problem, it's top and mid Morde.  Top/mid has 54/55% wr and jg has 47% wr.

https://na.op.gg/champion/mordekaiser/statistics/top
Oh also, Keystones for this build include Hail of Blades with lifesteal runes and Tenacity / Last Stand as Secondary.
